workflow.name: Automatic invoice due date reminders from Stripe to Google Calendar
workflow.description:
## Description
Automatically track Stripe invoices and create Google Calendar reminders for upcoming due dates. This workflow ensures you never miss a payment deadline by running daily checks, filtering invoices due within the next 7 days, and adding them to your calendar with invoice details. ‚è∞üí≥üìÖ

## What This Template Does
- Runs daily at 8:00 AM using a scheduled trigger. ‚è∞
- Fetches draft invoices from Stripe. üí≥
- Splits invoice data into individual records for processing. üîé
- Filters invoices due within the next 7 days. üìÜ
- Prevents duplicates by checking against existing calendar events. üîÑ
- Creates Google Calendar events for valid invoices with details (ID, customer, amount). üìÖ

## Key Benefits
- Automated invoice due date reminders with no manual effort. ‚ö°
- Avoids duplicate entries in Google Calendar. üõ°Ô∏è
- Provides a clear overview of pending payments. üëÄ
- Saves time for freelancers, agencies, and finance teams. ‚è±Ô∏è
- Keeps all payment reminders in one central place. üì≤

## Features
- Daily schedule with cron expression (0 8 * * *).
- Stripe API integration to fetch draft invoices.
- Smart filtering: only invoices with due dates within 7 days are selected.
- Google Calendar integration to check existing events and avoid duplicates.
- Detailed calendar events with invoice ID, amount due, and customer email.
- Customizable reminders ‚Äî add customer name, invoice link, or change times.

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Stripe API credentials with invoice read access.
- Google Calendar OAuth2 credentials with event write permissions.
- Access to the target Google Calendar (replace placeholder with your own).

## Target Audience
- Freelancers and solopreneurs managing invoices. üë©‚Äçüíª
- Agencies tracking multiple client invoices. üè¢
- Finance and accounting teams requiring automated reminders. üìä
- Businesses wanting to automate payment follow-ups. üíº
- Remote teams centralizing billing schedules. üåç

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Configure Stripe API credentials in n8n.
- Add Google Calendar OAuth2 credentials with access to your target calendar.
- Replace the placeholder calendar ID (your-calendar@gmail.com) with your actual calendar.
- Import this workflow into n8n.
- Test the workflow by creating a test draft invoice in Stripe with a due date in the next 7 days.
- Verify the Google Calendar event is created with the invoice details.
- Enable the workflow to run daily and enjoy hands-free invoice tracking. ‚úÖ

parameters.content:
## üìã Stripe Invoice to Google Calendar Automation

This workflow automatically monitors Stripe invoices and creates Google Calendar reminders for invoices due within the next 7 days.

### Key Features:
- Daily scheduled execution at 8 AM
- Fetches draft invoices from Stripe
- Filters invoices due within 7 days
- Creates calendar events only for new invoices
- Prevents duplicate calendar entries

### Prerequisites:
- Stripe API credentials configured
- Google Calendar OAuth2 credentials
- Access to target Google Calendar

### Use Case:
Perfect for freelancers, agencies, or businesses that need automated invoice due date tracking and reminders.

## ‚è∞ Daily Schedule Setup

Configured to run every day at 8:00 AM using cron expression `0 8 * * *`

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Adjust the cron expression if needed
2. Consider your timezone settings
3. Test with a shorter interval during setup

**Cron Format:** `minute hour day month dayofweek`

## üí≥ Stripe API Configuration

**Setup Steps:**
1. Go to n8n Credentials
2. Add new Stripe API credential
3. Enter your Stripe Secret Key
4. Test the connection

**Query Parameters:**
- `status=draft`: Only fetch draft invoices
- `limit=100`: Maximum 100 invoices per request

## üìã Processing Invoice Array

The Stripe API returns invoices in a `data` array. This node splits the array so we can process each invoice individually.

**What it does:**
- Takes the `data` field from Stripe response
- Creates separate items for each invoice
- Enables individual processing downstream

## üîç Invoice Due Date Filter

Filters invoices based on due date criteria:

**Conditions (ALL must be true):**
1. Invoice has a due date
2. Due within next 7 days
3. Due date is today or later

**Logic:**
- Converts dates to Unix timestamps
- Uses JavaScript expressions for calculations
- Only passes invoices meeting all criteria

## üìÖ Google Calendar Setup

**Configuration Steps:**
1. Create Google Calendar OAuth2 credentials
2. Select your target calendar
3. Set time range (next 30 days)

**Purpose:**
Fetches existing calendar events to check for duplicate invoice reminders.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Note:** Replace the calendar ID with your actual calendar email

## üîÑ Duplicate Detection

**Logic:**
1. Extracts invoice IDs from existing calendar events
2. Looks for pattern `invoice_id:XXXXXX` in event descriptions
3. Compares current invoice ID with existing ones

**Fields Created:**
- `existing_invoice_ids`: Array of found invoice IDs
- `current_invoice_id`: Current invoice being processed

values.name: existing_invoice_ids

parameters.content:
## ‚úÖ New Invoice Validation

**Conditions (OR logic):**
1. Invoice ID not found in existing events
2. Current invoice ID exists and is valid

**Result:**
Only new invoices (not already in calendar) will proceed to create calendar events.

## üìÖ Create Calendar Reminder

**Event Details:**
- **Title:** "Pending Invoice"
- **Start Time:** Invoice due date
- **Duration:** 1 hour
- **Description:** Includes invoice ID for tracking

**Customization Ideas:**
- Add customer name to title
- Include invoice amount
- Set custom reminder times
- Add invoice URL to description

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
